channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Harris and Biden surveyed damage wrought by Hurricane Helene in 2 swing states
item.description: President Biden and Vice President Harris traveled to Georgia and North Carolina to reassure people that help is on the way. Making good on that promise is a critical test in this election year.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden and Vice President Harris traveled to Georgia and North Carolina to reassure people that help is on the way. Making good on that promise is a critical test in this election year.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: On a Tennessee street hit hard by Helene flooding, strangers show up to help
item.description: Across Eastern Tennessee, people are connecting on social media to help clear out ruined furniture, scrub off mud, and deliver jugs of water so people can flush toilets.
item.content:encoded:
Across Eastern Tennessee, people are connecting on social media to help clear out ruined furniture, scrub off mud, and deliver jugs of water so people can flush toilets.

(Image credit: Jennifer Ludden)
item.dc:creator: Marisa Peñaloza

item.title: Neighbors have been helping neighbors recover from hurricane Helene
item.description: The effort to recover from Hurricane Helene is only beginning. But neighbors and volunteers from humanitarian organizations are pitching in to help.
item.content:encoded:
The effort to recover from Hurricane Helene is only beginning. But neighbors and volunteers from humanitarian organizations are pitching in to help.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)

item.title: Judge unseals new evidence against Trump in the Jan. 6 election interference case
item.description: Prosecutors provided the most detailed look yet at their election interference case against former President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Prosecutors provided the most detailed look yet at their election interference case against former President Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: After helping in war and quake zones, this restaurateur feeds residents hit by Helene
item.description: Jamie McDonald has provided meals in Ukraine and Turkey as a volunteer with World Central Kitchen. Now, he's partnering with the global charity led by José Andrés to feed residents in Asheville.
item.content:encoded:
Jamie McDonald has provided meals in Ukraine and Turkey as a volunteer with World Central Kitchen. Now, he's partnering with the global charity led by José Andrés to feed residents in Asheville.

(Image credit: World Central Kitchen)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: The Fight Over Who Writes the History of Modern China
item.description: As China celebrates 75 years of Communist Party rule, there is a fight over who gets to tell the history of those years. The party would prefer to make sure the story is a positive one and is exerting power to control that narrative. One high profile example of that is playing out far away, in California.
item.content:encoded:
As China celebrates 75 years of Communist Party rule, there is a fight over who gets to tell the history of those years. The party would prefer to make sure the story is a positive one and is exerting power to control that narrative. One high profile example of that is playing out far away, in California.

(Image credit: John Ruwitch)
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: John Leguizamo went into 'super sleuth dad' mode to help his son learn Latino history
item.description: "America does not function without Latino immigrants," Leguizamo says. His new three-part PBS docuseries, VOCES American Historia, highlights Latino contributions to American history and culture.
item.content:encoded:
"America does not function without Latino immigrants," Leguizamo says. His new three-part PBS docuseries, VOCES American Historia, highlights Latino contributions to American history and culture.

(Image credit: Phil McCarten)
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: A court blocks a couple from suing Uber over a crash, citing terms and conditions
item.description: An appeals court sided with Uber, ruling a couple can't sue over a near-fatal car crash because they had agreed to Uber's arbitration clause. Their lawyer is worried about a "slippery slope."
item.content:encoded: An appeals court sided with Uber, ruling a couple can't sue over a near-fatal car crash because they had agreed to Uber's arbitration clause. Their lawyer is worried about a "slippery slope."
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: How Iran’s missile strike on Israel appears to have hit some targets
item.description: Videos posted online suggest that two air bases were targeted by multiple incoming missiles. The strike appears to have been more sophisticated than one earlier this year.
item.content:encoded:
Videos posted online suggest that two air bases were targeted by multiple incoming missiles. The strike appears to have been more sophisticated than one earlier this year.

(Image credit: Menahem Kahana)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: This disabled woman built a career. A federal program that helped now penalizes her
item.description: Supplemental Security Income provides the medical care that lets people work. But its rules are complex and out of date.
item.content:encoded:
Supplemental Security Income provides the medical care that lets people work. But its rules are complex and out of date. 

(Image credit: JPMorgan Chase)
item.dc:creator: Joseph Shapiro
